item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification

item.title: R and Python Can Work Together!
item.description: R can work with python to achieve a variety of goals in convenient ways. For example, below is a short nucleotide sequence that we will define in R as “dnaseq”. #this is a R code chunk library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 dnaseq <- "ATGGCAATAACCCCCCGTTTCTACTTCTAGAGGAGAAAAGTATTGACATGAGCGCTCCCGGCACAAGGGCCAAAGAAGTCTCCAATTTCTTATTTCCGAATGACATGCGTCTCCTTGCGGGTAAATCACCGACCGCAATTCATAGAAGCCTGGGGGAACAGATAGGTCTAATTAGCTTAAGAGAGTAAATCCTGGGATCATTCAGTAGTAACCATAAACTTACGCTGGGCGCGCTTATAG" #your code here Using Python, we are able to determine the length of the sequence and save it as the variable “lon”.

Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis author: Abraham Joshua Mathew uteid: ajm5874 date: ’3/16/20 Introduction In this project, the dataset “babynames” was imported and combined with the dataset “unisex_names”. By comparing these two datasets, it is possible to analyze the history of unisex names in america, including how common they are, the distribution of the names across sex, and their changes in popularity over the years. For some background the dataset “babynames”, it was provided by the social security administration and it contains all names with at least 5 uses from as early as 1880.

item.title: Project 2: Statistical Analysis
item.description: Abraham Joshua Mathew Introduction For this project, I chose data focused on the perceived height and weight of individuals. It contains the biological sex, actual height (cm) and weight (kg), and reported height(cm) and weight(kg) of each individual enrolled in the study. Additionally, each participant was assigned an ID number. There are 200 observations total in this study. Performing MANOVA To determine the role of “Biological Sex” in determing “Reported Weight”, “Actual Weight”, “Reported Height”, and “Actual Height” a MANOVA test was performed below.
